meanings.definition: To divide or break into fractions.
meanings.sent1: I will fractionalize the pizza into smaller slices for everyone to share.
meanings.sent2: She decided to fractionalize her savings into different accounts for better organization.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to fractionalize his assistant into tiny pieces, but it was just an illusion.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to fractionalize the colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The chef's skillful hands were able to fractionalize the ingredients into perfectly equal portions.

meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to fractionalize the chocolate bar into halves.
meanings.sent2: It is important to fractionalize the time you spend on different tasks to be more efficient.
meanings.sent3: The aliens tried to fractionalize the Earth into tiny pieces to take back to their planet.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to fractionalize the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The machine was able to fractionalize the liquid into precise measurements for the experiment.

meanings.definition: To separate into smaller parts or groups.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to fractionalize its departments to focus on specific tasks.
meanings.sent2: The new software can fractionalize the data into more manageable chunks for analysis.
meanings.sent3: The kids wanted to fractionalize the playground into different sections for various games.
meanings.sent4: His speech seemed to fractionalize the audience into supporters and skeptics.
meanings.sent5: The storm threatened to fractionalize the community, but they came together to face it as one.
